result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Fedder

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant Michael R. Fedder in court.  Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler in court for Michael R. Fedder.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. 
Defense has received discovery and is working on an offer with the State. 
This case should resolve, but will tagalong with a Portage County case resolving in May.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:24 AM Defendant Michael R. Fedder in court with attorney Olivia Garman for attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Parties stipulate to extending the scheduling of the matter out further to track the Portage County DPA. 
The Court so grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

08:24 AM Defendant Michael R. Fedder in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
